original_title: Sri Lanka to help Maldives develop agriculture: official
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka plans to help the Maldivian agricultural sector develop its technical capabilities, an official said.

Maldives Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Marine Affairs Hussain Rasheed Hassan said Sri Lanka’s efforts towards development of its agricultural sector has drawn the attention of his government.

Dhama Wanninayake, Media secretary to Sri Lanka’s Minister of Agriculture, told EconomyNext on Thursday June 08 that since the Maldives lacks freshwater sources and the soil to cultivate fruits and vegetables, Sri Lankan-style net houses are being considered.
A net house or a shade house is a structure enclosed by agro nets or any other woven material to allow required sunlight, moisture and air to pass through the gaps.
In Sri Lanka, net houses are popular among many farmers in the cultivation of fruits, vegetables and floriculture.
“The Maldives will help us in the growth of tourism and also exporting fish, and in exchange, we will help them develop their agriculture,” said Wanninayake..
According to Export Development Board (EDB) data, the Maldives is Sri Lanka’s top 24th export destination.
The total export value from Sri Lanka to the archipelagos was 106.19 million US dollars in 2022 while total imports from there to Sri Lanka for the same period were 4.37 Million.

Sri Lanka’s main export products to the Maldives in 2022 were sugar, sugar confectionery and bakery products, cereals and related products, meat, preparations of meat/fish and dairy products and fruit and vegetable products. (Colombo/Jun10/2023)
